description: From Latin genuinus (“innate, native, natural”), from gignere, from Old Latin genere (“to beget, produce”); see genus.

adjectives.description: genuine (comparative more genuine, superlative most genuine)

entries.meaning: Belonging to, or proceeding from the original stock; native
Not counterfeit, spurious, false, or adulterated
examples: a genuine text;  a genuine production;  genuine materials; genuine friendship
